Detailed Description

Abstract time keeping device.

This objects provides functionality for modifying the speed of the clock or steeping through clock ticks. For atomic clocks (such as a wall clock or a CPU cycles clock) this functionality should still be provided for debugging purposes.

Member Function Documentation

double omi::runtime::AbstractClock::get_multiplier ( ) const

Returns the multiplier being used on the rate of time by this clock.

Note
Defaults to 1.0
void omi::runtime::AbstractClock::resume ( )

Resumes normal ticking of the clock if it has been paused.

If the clock is not currently paused this function does nothing.

void omi::runtime::AbstractClock::step ( time_int  amount,
Metric  metric = METRIC_MILLISECONDS 
)

Steps the clock by the given amount if the clock is currently paused.

If the clock in not paused this function will have no affect.

Parameters
amountThe amount to step the clock by.
metricThe time metric that the amount parameter represents.
virtual time_int omi::runtime::AbstractClock::tick ( )
protectedpure virtual

Should be implemented by derived classes and returns the current time for the device this clock is using.

This function should not handle time multipliers or explicit stepping as that will be handled by the AbstractClock class.

Implemented in omi::runtime::GameClock, and omi::runtime::WallClock.
